From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: fahrt and fährt

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old High German vart, from Proto-West Germanic *fardi, derived from *faraną (“to go, travel”), from Proto-Indo-European *per- (“going, passage”). Cognate with Dutch vaart, Swedish färd.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /faːrt/, [fa(ː)ʁt], [fa(ː)ɐ̯t], [faːt]
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Homophones: fahrt (general), fad, Pfad (some speakers)

Noun

[edit]

Fahrt f (genitive Fahrt, plural Fahrten)

  1. drive
  2. ride
  3. journey

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Fahrt [feminine]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative eine die Fahrt die Fahrten
genitive einer der Fahrt der Fahrten
dative einer der Fahrt den Fahrten
accusative eine die Fahrt die Fahrten
